title: Wrong error message when `spack uninstall` cannot find a matching installed package
body:
`spack uninstall` outputs a message saying to use a more specific spec if it cannot find any matching packages.  This message is similar to when you try and uninstall a spec that matches multiple packages. 

### Expected Result
```
# herbein1 at hype2 in /nfs/tmp2/herbein1/dev-day [12:43:03]
→ spack uninstall flux-core@master ^lua@5.2
==> Error: flux-core@master ^lua@5.2 does not match any installed packages.

# herbein1 at hype2 in /nfs/tmp2/herbein1/dev-day [12:43:48]
→ spack find flux-core@master ^lua@5.2
==> No package matches the query: flux-core@master ^lua@5.2
```

### Actual Result
```
# herbein1 at hype2 in /nfs/tmp2/herbein1/dev-day [12:43:03]
→ spack uninstall flux-core@master ^lua@5.2
==> Error: flux-core@master ^lua@5.2 does not match any installed packages.
==> Error: You can either:
    a) use a more specific spec, or
    b) use `spack uninstall --all` to uninstall ALL matching specs.

# herbein1 at hype2 in /nfs/tmp2/herbein1/dev-day [12:43:48]
→ spack find flux-core@master ^lua@5.2
==> No package matches the query: flux-core@master ^lua@5.2
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
# Clean install of spack
$ spack uninstall <insert any package name>
...
```

### Information on your system

This includes:

 1. which platform you are using: x86_64 TOSS3 system at LLNL
